document.docAuthor: García Aldrete, Alfonso N., Obando, Ranulfo González & Carrejo, Nancy S.
document.docTitle: Dagualachesilla Aldrete, Obando & Carrejo, 2013, n. gen.
document.masterDocTitle: New genera of Lachesillidae (Psocodea: ’ Psocoptera’: Eolachesillinae: Graphocaeciliini) from Valle del Cauca, Colombia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New genera of Lachesillidae (Psocodea: ’ Psocoptera’: Eolachesillinae: Graphocaeciliini) from Valle del Cauca, Colombia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Belonging in the Graphocaeciliini . Ocelli absent. Forewing veins with a row of conspicuous setae, except on Cu 2 . Hypandrium with sides and posterior border distinctly thickened. Endophallus large, formed by a compact group of small sclerites. Aedeagal arch projected posteriorly in the middle. External parameres broad, with a slender, distal projection. Posterior border of clunium, over the area of the epiproct, with a broad, elongate, curved, spatulate posterior projection that covers most of the epiproct. Male paraprocts with a distinct, elongate sclerotized anterior projection, joined to clunium. Female subgenital plate with a median concavity posteriorly; gonapophyses joined to clunium,
V 1
absent, and
V 2
+ 3 elongate, joined to clunium, distally pointed, with a row of macrosetae along outer border.

Etymology. The generic name is a compound word formed with Dagua, the municipality where the two species of this genus were found, and
Lachesilla
.

Type species.
Dagualachesilla anchicayaensis
n. sp.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female. Color (in 80 % ethyl alcohol). Same as the male.
Etymology. The specific name refers to one of the localities where this species was found: Anchicayá.

Material studied . Holotype male. COLOMBIA . Valle del Cauca, Dagua, Queremal, La Elsa (
3 ° 33 ' 56.1 ''N
:
76 ° 44 ' 01.9''W
, 1032 m .),

, MUSENUV slide code 24309 , R. González. Paratypes :

,

, Buenaventura, Alto Anchicayá, ca. Represa (

:

,
656 m .
),
11 .IX. 2010
, MUSENUV slide codes 24310, 24311, R. González.

,

, same data as the holotype ,
